content:
To horizontally center an element and limit its width, a common approach is to set a maximum width and use `margin: 0 auto;`. For example:

.page-wrap {
  max-width: 1000px;
  margin: 0 auto;
}

If you need to enforce spacing from the parent container's edges, you can add padding to the parent, like the `body` element:

body {
  padding: 0 1rem;
}

Alternatively, you can achieve this spacing and centering with a single CSS property using `margin-inline` with a `max()` function:

.page-wrap {
  margin-inline: max(1.5rem, ((100% - 500px) / 2));
}

In this one-liner, `1.5rem` represents the desired outer spacing (which can be set to `0`), and `500px` is the `max-width` (or `max-inline-size` when using logical properties).
